intro: Ventilago borneensis, commonly known as the Borneo velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
